Key Match Events: The Kings beat the Celtics at their own game by making more three-pointers.
The Celtics were out-rebounded by Sabonis, who grabbed as many offensive rebounds as the entire Celtics team.
The Kings' collective defense has been strong since Doug Christie took over as head coach, ranking 6th in defense since Christmas.
The Kings scored 1.3 points per possession from offensive rebounds.
The Celtics struggled with pick-and-roll defense, allowing Sabonis and other Kings players to exploit mismatches.
Jayson Tatum had an off night against the Kings' blitz defense, resulting in 8 turnovers.
Jaylen Brown was effective in the paint, making 8 out of 12 attempts.
Kristaps Porzingis struggled with post-up plays, generating fewer points per post-up compared to last season.
The Celtics' offensive execution in the fourth quarter was poor, with Jayson Tatum not attempting any field goals.
DeMar DeRozan scored 12 points and delivered 4 assists in the fourth quarter, leading the Kings to victory.
